comments: Took her online anthro300 class, it was very organized and predictable. Discussions were clear and there were a few short videos to watch a week and one Inquisitive, which could take a couple hours but is worth it since nothing else takes up too much time. Strongly recommend the online class if anthro isn\'t your major.

comments: The online class is great and easy. Every thing is clear and organized. Easy tests and discussions. However Prof Tyler does not respond to you which is frustrating especially when trying to get a hold of her. She also took a very long time grading. Although the class is an easy A, if you have an important question; don\'t expect her to respond.

comments: I took Professor Tyler\'s 8 week hybrid. The class was graded entirely on the online work. and discussions every week. All of he answers to every quiz or online or in the book. If you keep up with the course work you will get an A. I highly recommend taking her!

comments: I only had an A in this class because I contacted her through the phone; any other method and she doesn\'t responds. Her Grading is very tough, but if you hit gold and write about a topic she likes, she will give an A. The Tests were on questions on specific facts and one-liners in the book, so you need to read carefully. Call her if you want an A.

The best thing about her online class is that you are not forced to reply to other students weekly discussion posts. The only complaint is her lack of communication and grading.

comments: I took Tyler\'s online Anthro 300 class, was not the best class. She had a sub for us for a whole month, took a long time grading assignments, and did not put a lot of effort into her online class. The quizzes did not correspond with the chapters, and test were very random. Maybe in class she is great but stay away from her online class.

comments: I really love Professor Tyler! Very helpful, sweet, and very clear on her lectures. The tests and quizzes were very easy. I took her online class. I really enjoyed her online class and enjoyed watching her lectures. I\'m a DSPS student and she really took the time to make sure I understood the lectures. I recommend taking this teacher!!

comments: Erica is a wonderful person. I liked her a lot and she is so funny. However, she doesn\'t respond to emails at all and was gone for about a month so it got a little harder for us since we had a sub who went off track a bit. Overall, her class was good. I recommend her, but just make sure you take the quizzes. Tests are timed quizzes are not.

comments: Professor Tyler is a nice professor, very knowledgeable about Anthropology. I really learned a lot and enjoyed her class. However, she doesn\'t answer e-mails and she doesn\'t let students know when she doesn\'t show up. My class finished on February because i took the 8 first week class and until now 05/21/16, she did not post grades yet.

comments: Mrs. Tyler is by far my favorite professor I have ever taken at FLC. She made anthro very enjoyable and easy to understand. She prepares you very well for the tests just take note on the powerepoint all the test questions come from them. Shes pretty attractive which makes it easy to pay attention lol. She makes class fun, I highly recommend her.

comments: Take notes from her lecture slides to answer the study guides she hands out. Test questions are from her study guides and quizzes. I didn\'t read the book. I did look up a few things in there but it\'s not necessary. She hands out quite a bit of extra credit. Lectures are pretty interesting and keeps you engaged. Do everything and you should get an A
